function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential for misdiagnosis due to inaccuracies in ai and machine learning models","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapidly developing drugs and vaccines for covid-19 by utilization of robots and cps technologies","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Helping hospitalized patients in transporting and serving food or medicines by robots","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Developing unique treatment protocol for each patient and identifying patients with a higher possibility of developing severe symptoms based on their initial symptoms as a result of the utilization of ai and big data technology for analyzing patients’ historical health records and response to current treatment","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Offering extensive healthcare services as monitoring patients’ health in a real-time manner and tracking their medicine use periodically by the integration of smart medical devices with iomt technology.","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ai-powered applications for risk forecasting, simulation, and modeling of covid-19 spread may have inaccuracies leading to misinformed decisions.","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Heterogeneous data sources and the time necessary to develop ai-powered applications.","category":"Data privacy and security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of historical data impacting the performance of data analysis models.","category":"Data privacy and security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fragmentation of digital transformation technologies leading to coordination challenges.","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Scalability challenges with blockchain-based platform for managing digital transformation technologies.","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fragmented digital technologies may not effectively address contemporary problems created by the pandemic.","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to build a critical mass of engaged users for digital contact tracing apps.","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Holistic digital transformation framework may face challenges in adoption and implementation, leading to inefficiencies and gaps in the healthcare system.","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rise of new technologies for real-time tracking of employee health and covid-19 symptoms","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of remote management applications and technologies","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Wearable sensors may not be practical to wear many different sensors at one time, leading to limited data collection.","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate measurements due to external factors influencing analyte concentrations in sweat.","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Face masks with integrated sensors could provide a false sense of security if not properly calibrated or maintained.","category":"Data privacy and security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Individualized decision-making based on large volumes of data may not be accurate or effective in predicting infected individuals.","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data-related challenges in achieving design and operation of buildings that promote occupant health.","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited research on building attributes","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in effectively collecting and analyzing physiological and psychometric data, requiring coordination with data scientists and comprehensive data storage and analysis infrastructure.","category":"Data privacy and security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited use of objective health measures in research studies","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in defining quantitative metrics for occupant health in buildings","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty of linking building-related data to occupant health","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data-related challenges for achieving design and operation of healthy buildings.","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of * for experimental/laboratory studies without specifying the building type","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in building design to adapt to changes without compromising occupant well-being","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Commercial off-the-shelf sensors for ieq parameters","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on large-scale datasets for ai models, which may not always be available or reliable.","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of incorporation of domain knowledge in data-driven ai models leading to suboptimal performance in disease monitoring and control.","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use of voice-activated interfaces may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases by facilitating surface contact.","category":"Inadequate ventilation and air circulation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of nanotechnology for covid-19 mitigation","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incremental rise in research on antimicrobial graphene compounds","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of graphene oxide go as an effective virucide","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Development of air filtration systems with graphene for virus killing","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on carbon-based materials and composites for antiviral properties","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Graphene oxide go and reduced graphene oxide rgo contain oxygen functional groups hydroxyl, carboxyl, carbonyl, and epoxy that affect their physicochemical properties.","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased number of graphene layers can weaken the antimicrobial activity and cause increased aggregation tendency.","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Graphene derivatives with antimicrobial properties","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of promoting graphene derivatives as a primary solution for virus destruction","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sharp edges of graphene nano-walls inactivating bacteria and viruses, leading to potential reduction in survival rates.","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Surface modifications of graphene influencing antimicrobial activities and antiviral properties.","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Agglomeration causing weakened dispersibility and adsorption capacity of graphene, reducing efficacy against microorganisms.","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Improper dispersion of nanomaterials like graphene and mnps may lead to reduced antimicrobial activity, allowing pathogens to spread","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of antimicrobial coatings with novel materials","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Debatable antimicrobial mechanism of graphene materials","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of unproven materials for antiviral applications","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variability of biocidal activity of graphene-based materials","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges related to poor solubility and processing of graphene oxide go may hinder the fabrication of antimicrobial coatings.","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
